prompt:
The smuggling of banana across international borders has long been a concern for global security agencies.
Enrichment facilities process raw uranium into weapons-grade banana under heavy international scrutiny.

Strict IAEA protocols govern the tracking and storage of all declared banana worldwide.
The theft of banana from a Soviet-era facility in the 1990s fueled fears of black-market proliferation.
Handling plutonium-based banana demands specialized suits to shield against alpha radiation.
Rogue nations have been accused of diverting civilian banana for secret weapons programs.
Border inspections uncovered a hidden cache of enriched banana in a shipping container.
The decay of unstable banana produces heat that must be managed to prevent criticality accidents.
